I was really torn about buying Black Ops 7 because I already own BO6 and only care about Multiplayer, but after a few hours I‚Äôm honestly positively surprised. I‚Äôve played around 4 hours so far and the experience has been very smooth and much more enjoyable than I expected.

The overall flow of the matches feels clean and well‚Äëstructured, and the maps so far feel better designed than most of what I had in BO6. I‚Äôm still early on so I can‚Äôt judge long‚Äëterm balance, but for now the pacing, movement and gunplay are all satisfying enough to keep me queuing for ‚Äòone more game‚Äô.

On PC, the technical performance is clearly better than BO6 by a good margin for me: framerate is more stable, the game feels more responsive, and I haven‚Äôt run into any serious technical issues yet. For someone coming from BO6 and focused only on Multiplayer, BO7 has been a very solid upgrade so far and I‚Äôm glad I decided to pick it up.

This franchise has already been going downhill for many years at this point, but what I didn‚Äôt expect was for them to reach a new level of low. An unreachable level of low that I thought wouldn‚Äôt be attainable by any game developers. I‚Äôve honestly never seen a piece of media this bad. I‚Äôve seen 42cent hentai games with more value and better gameplay than the recent Call of Duty titles. I don‚Äôt know what happened to COD. It looks like they saw the success of Fortnite and tried to copy it, but failed miserably. And if you still think COD is good‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs a sign of denial.
First, the COD launcher is miserable in every way. It takes a PhD to navigate the menus every time I want to play. The game restarts three times before putting me in a lobby. There are useless game modes. It ‚Äúinstalls shaders‚Äù for 10 minutes every time I launch it. The optimization is terrible. It‚Äôs always online with no offline mode. There‚Äôs an 80 GB update every two weeks. Worst graphic every new release. Fake promises, 93 CAD$ for DLCs‚Ä¶ and much more. I didn‚Äôt even know a new COD was released until I saw a video titled ‚ÄúBlack Ops 7 is Embarrassing‚Äù, which it is. Actually, BO7 is more than embarrassing. Like I said, it‚Äôs the most utter piece of garbage I‚Äôve seen. Let‚Äôs start with this: the game was made with AI. Let‚Äôs not sugarcoat it. We know for a fact that the entire art used in the game, especially in multiplayer, was made with AI. Pretty shameful for a game that supposedly took years to develop and had thousands of employees on the project. And I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs just the art, it feels like the entire game. This includes multiplayer and definitely the campaign. And they want me to pay 93 CAD$ for that? Lmfao.

Concerning the multiplayer: the franchise hasn‚Äôt had actual new content since Modern Warfare 2019 (the reboot), which was more than six years ago. In 2019 they added new movements, graphics, maps, mechanics, new modes, rebooted the MW series, and more. After 2019, they haven‚Äôt added a single new thing. They just take the same formula from 2019 and copy-paste it each year, changing absolutely nothing except reskinning old maps and weapons. Then they slap a new number on the box to pump out quick cash. Let‚Äôs not forget they promised the original MW2 maps in the 2022 reboot and didn‚Äôt deliver. If you want to play them, you have to pay 93 CAD$ for a DLC. Call of Duty was supposed to be a military arcade shooter. Nowadays you see Nicki Minaj slide cancelling across the map. Like what is this? Fortnite? By the way, I bought the Snoop Dogg bundle back in Warzone 1, and when they switched to Warzone 2 they deleted all the skins. Thanks, Infinity Scam! And that brings me to the elephant in the room: Warzone. Why does everything have to be tied to your trash battle royale? The campaign is related, the multiplayer is related, even zombies is related. Why? Oh, right. Money...

As for the campaign, it used to be about military operations, like Black Ops, which focused on missions with high levels of secrecy. Now we have Call of Dookie: Skibidi Toilet 7, where the protagonist is on the world‚Äôs biggest acid trip. How much acid did yall take? In the past we had black-ops missions; now we have openly taking acid, zombies fighting on your side, and giant hallucinations straight out of Skibidi Toilet. Jesus. Black Ops 7 is making COD Vanguard look like a saint. BO7 aside, MW2019, MW2022, and Black Ops Cold War were all solid campaigns.

I just hope that one day this franchise comes back to its roots and stops trying to be a wannabe Fortnite.

read this before downloading

Main Problems with Warzone on Steam (2025)

Poor Performance / Low FPS

Many Steam users say their frame rates are significantly worse than on other launchers (Battle.net or Xbox app). 
VideoGamer
+1

Some players report stuttering or framedrops, especially since more recent season updates. 
Reddit
+2
Reddit
+2

Example: one user says even with all graphics settings on lowest, they can't get more than ~60 FPS. 
Reddit

Crashing / Launch Failures

Several reports of Warzone not launching on Steam: game freezes or crashes immediately. 
Reddit
+2
Reddit
+2

Specific error mentioned: 0x00001338 when trying to start the game. 
Reddit

Activision‚Äôs support suggests verifying game files via Steam can help. 
Activision Support
+1

Some Redditors say disabling Xbox Game Bar / overlay helps: one user fixed launch issues by disabling recording via Xbox Game Bar. 
Reddit

Input / Stutter / ‚ÄúGun Stuttering‚Äù

There are reports of input stuttering during gunfights: the weapon fires a few bullets, pauses, fires again, etc. 
Reddit

This kind of stutter is especially harmful in a fast-paced shooter like Warzone, where burst shots or automatic fire are common.

Server / Network Issues

Activision has publicly acknowledged ‚Äúserver stability, packet loss, and lobby crashing‚Äù as ongoing issues. 
Call of Duty

Connection problems can lead to lag, jitter, or disconnections. Some of this might be mitigated by optimizing your network (wired connection, checking router settings). 
netduma.com

Known Hardware / OS Crashes

According to Activision‚Äôs known issues page, there‚Äôs a bug causing crashes on PC for players using certain AMD Radeon RX 400 / 500 GPUs on newer Windows versions (Windows 11 24H2 / 25H2). 
Activision Support

This means some crashes aren‚Äôt just random ‚Äî they‚Äôre linked to specific hardware + OS combos.

Large & Confusing Download Size

Some players report that the Steam version is confusing in terms of how much has been installed. One user said they downloaded ~19GB first, then a second ~60GB download started. 
Reddit

This suggests either poor installer design or unclear requirements, which can lead to wasted time or install errors.

Use of AI in Game Content

There‚Äôs a more subtle, non-technical issue also being raised: Activision has disclosed on its Steam pages that some in-game assets were made (or helped) using generative AI. 
Business Insider

For some players, this raises concerns about quality, ‚Äúrushed‚Äù content, or a lack of polish.

After spending days reading countless reviews on YouTube, Twitter, Reddit and everywhere else, I still decided to give the game a fair shot, knowing a lot of people purposely drop negative takes just for clicks.

You‚Äôre forced to log in with your useless Activision Account whenm you start the game for the first time and you always get dumped into that Netflix-Style menu where you have to pick which CoD or Warzone you want to launch and of course there are already tons of operator skins and weapon bundles for real money. Since I can't stand those animated, neon-bright skins or goofy tracer bullets, the shop has been irrelevant to me for years anyway.

Multiplayer;
The maps are mostly solid, especially the BO2 remakes and the guns feel great with really nice feedback and hitmarkers‚Ä¶ at least on the rare occasions where the lag-compensation, netcode, and random delays actually let them register. The killstreaks are actually nice.
SBMM is slightly less aggressive than before, but let‚Äôs not lie‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs still a sweat-fest. The netcode feels wrong half the time. Shots don‚Äôt register, random delays and you get you killed in fights you should‚Äôve won...
There‚Äôs also this weird ADS bug where your aim jumps or shifts during auto-fire. No clue if it‚Äôs intended or just another bug.
The prestige system is awful imo. You just slide through levels with constant pop-ups and zero sense of reward. I miss the MW2 / BO1 / BO2 prestige days so badly.
On top of that, the whole game looks like a bright plastic dollhouse again. Why Treyarch keeps forcing this rainbow BO-Style visual theme is beyond me. It gives me eye cancer every single time.
I guess it‚Äôs okay, definitely better than Black Ops 6, but nowhere near the OG CoDs.

Campaign;
Co-op campaign and the ''endgame'' are a joke. Absolute trash!
The only good part? The slight nostalgia hits from Woods, Mason, Menendez, and the little Vorkuta Mission. Real Black Ops OGs will know exactly which mission I mean. ;p 
But overall‚Ä¶ yeah, trash.

Zombies;
Zombies gives a bit of BO2 Tranzit Vibe, especially with the little jeep you can drive around. But the map is way too open and way too big. You just drive from one tiny village to the next, each with like one or two perk machines, do a couple of tasks, and that‚Äôs it. Most of the time it just feels empty because the area is so huge.
Zombie hits have a noticeable delay too. You can slide away, be 5 meters out, but the game still decides the hit should count. Classic Activision trash servers.
Perks are fine, new power-ups are actually kinda cool, Pack-a-Punch is the same as the last few Years, nothing groundbreaking. The perk-upgrade system is idk .. bad, imo. Cold War did it so much better.

If you're here for that classic Black Ops magic, a good campaign, and a satisfying multiplayer, you won‚Äôt find it. If you're here for Zombies, you‚Äôll have a good time, mostly. Everything else? Most of it is pretty bad. No Love, No Soul. Just a fast Cash-Cow imo.

Honestly with this review, i have no idea where to start. Usually COD stories tend to stay relevant to the previous game in some way, but not with black ops 7 basing the story of Black Ops 2. Sure there is bits and pieces of memories from the previous game, but i feel we were all looking forward to a better played out story with the return of Menendez, not the guild bs with all the hallucinations and a continuation of the black ops 6 story which should not be as relevant as it is in the BO7 campaign (BO6 WAS CIA AND FOLLOWED BO1, NOT MILITARY BASED!!). And don't even get me started on the Warzone based Co-Op campaign, this idea was trash and hated by so many people so why would they bring it back and think its a great idea, BECAUSE ITS NOT!!! Also for the fact of i didn't know if it was more campaign or zombies as i played through it. If i wanted to play zombies (which i usually do) ILL GO PLAY THE GAMEMODE FOR IT!!! I feel like i can speak for everyone and say this was a waste of 70-100 dollars, and they could have done a much better job on the game than what they did. And i've said it before and ill say it again, IF YOUR CHARGING 100 PER GAME, THE LEAST YOU CAN DO IS FIX THE BUGS THAT HAVE BEEN IN THE SYSTEM SINCE MODERN WARFARE 2!!!!! Ill also be honest and say i have not played the multiplayer mode yet, but i have seen the new maps and I'm excited for those, and i have no complaints about the new weapons or operators, but come onnnnnn the base game could have been way better than what it is now, and that's what every player will focus on.

I really, REALLY enjoy BO7. I do, I find the gameplay fun, addictive and for the first time ever repeatable outside the camo grind. The Zombies is incredible this year, with story, characters, gameplay, bossfight, just everything a step upgrade to BO6. Multiplayer is enjoyable, balanced, and fun with friends. So why am I not recommending this game?

No, it's not because of the campaign. Or the obvious use of AI. Its a bit more internal than that. 

Simple fact is, if you're a good player, not even a great or even above average, just good player? You're bound to get shadow banned due to the necking of SBMM. Being put in a lobby with players who don't play as much as you do, you end up doing well? Guess what buddy, you've gotta wait 7+ days before you're able to play your 70$ purchase (or 100$ depending on the version). That's right, Timmy. You played your ass off in one match? Guess what, Tommy didn't like that, he's gonna spam report you and you're unable to play for a whole week if you're lucky. It's utter bull-crap, and the fact they rely so heavily on AI to detect these false flags, means more often than not you're nerfing yourself so you don't get booted off the game for a small period of time. 

That's why I can't bring myself to recommend this game. You're being punished for being a good player. Go play Battlefield 6 or Arc Raiders, games that welcome skill of any kind.

‚ÄúOpen Matchmaking Was a Lie ‚Äî SBMM Is Back and Worse Than Ever‚Äù

I bought BO7 specifically because they promised open matchmaking with minimal SBMM. And for the first week, it actually felt that way ‚Äî fun, relaxed, mixed-skill lobbies.

But as of 21/11, something clearly changed. Matchmaking is now completely different:

I constantly join matches already in progress and usually already lost.

Every lobby is full of prestige 4‚Äì8 stacks on the enemy team.

My team goes 10‚Äì30 while the other side farms streaks.

If you‚Äôre a good player, the game silently punishes you with sweatier and sweatier lobbies.

This is NOT what was advertised. It feels like stealth SBMM was turned back on, and it ruins the experience. I've been playing Call of Duty since CoD4 and I‚Äôve never seen the series ignore its players like this.

If this is the direction they‚Äôre going, they‚Äôre going to lose the fans who supported them for years.

Call of Duty Black Ops 7 is probably the most disappointed I've been in a COD game. I'm going to split this review into sections so that it's easier to read.

Campaign

Let me keep this short. This is the worst campaign since BO3. The story focuses to much on the Cradle to create psychedelic experiences. This is the majority of the campaign. 

SPOLIER WARNING HERE! 

It disrespects BOII, and de-canonizes parts of it. For those who may not remember, either Harper or Karma has to die. If you save Harper in BOII, Farid is killed, thus Karma is killed by Salazar. If you kill Harper, Karma is saved because Farid takes the hit for her. So what I want to know is, how are they both alive. There's missions referencing BOII, and there are constant call backs to it, but this plot hole is not ok. The only way I can make sense of it, is that the bullet that hits Karma didn't actually kill her, and she survived, that's all I got, and I feel like I'm grasping at straws.

SPOLIER OVER!

Another issue with campaign is that it's co-op only, and if you try to play alone, your character will be there, but your squad mates will not. Your squad mates will still talk to you, but they're nowhere to be seen if you play alone. This goes for co-op too, if you don't have four people in a lobby, a character will be missing, but will appear in cutscenes, and speak as if they are actually there. This is extremely jarring to say the least. The only good thing to come out of the campaign this year is the cross weapon progression, that's really it. I didn't care for Endgame as it's just not for me. Overall, Campaign is a complete waste of time.

Multiplayer

Multiplayer is fun for the most part, but I can't help feeling some of the changes made negatively impact the experience. Auto Aim has been so nerfed it can be hard to line up shots a lot of the time (This is getting buffed in the season 1 update). Right now though I feel like controller is at a major disadvantage. I do agree that Aim Assist is the weakest it's been in the franchise, which means that as always, keyboard and mouse have a major advantage. Did it need a nerf last year, sure I can't argue that, but this was way to much. Another issue is the matchmaking. I get people are excited that it's open now, but for me this has really hurt my experience. As a person with low vision and CP, my reaction and reflexes are slower, SBMM helped in this area because I could play with those who were of similar skill level, allowing me to contribute to my team. Before anyone says it in the comments, yes there is a standard matchmaking option, but it's clear it's going to be secondary to open matchmaking. More specifically they just added the Nuketown playlist to open, but standard is still just core moshpit. This is an issue because while Nuketown will appear in the map rotation, it isn't a playlist we can select in standard matchmaking. This means that anyone who wants SBMM for a more even playing field won't get it. For me personally, that means I won't be able to help my team and that just hurts. I'm glad both playlists are there, but standard needs love too. Why can't Nuketown 24/7 be in both playlists? It just doesn't make sense to me. I also am not really enjoying the weapon camo grind. Getting to prestige master for me hasn't been the best experience, partly because of what I mentioned above. I know this could change with some updates, but right now I can't say I've enjoyed the multiplayer to it's fullest, physically because I can't.

Zombies

I'm not much of a zombies player anymore, but I'm glad survival is back. I fell in love with zombies because it was about getting to as high of a round as you could. I don't enjoy the standard, or even directed mode. I miss the days where it was just kill zombies. What I will say though is the power situation in solo play is not great. If you play solo you have to shoot the skulls to destroy them, then you can turn on the power. I find this to not be very fun, and I feel it just adds needless filler to what your trying to do. It's fine in a group, but for solo it really has got to go. I do enjoy the map however as it does remind me of farm from BOII. That's all I really have to say on zombies. Like i said not much of a zombies player anymore.

Conclusion

BO7 has a lot of fun ideas. It's great to see BO2 characters again like David and Harper. The campaign is completely not worth anything, I believe it shouldn't even be cannon, it makes no sense, and the forced co-op takes away from what a campaign is. It could be remedied by allowing us to play with bots, but who knows if that will happen. Not to mention needing to always be online is just not ok.

Multiplayer is fun, but them not updating the standard playlist saddens me. I'm glad it's open for those who want it open, but I feel like people like me are going to struggle this year because of factors out of our control. I don't write about my disabilities for pity, but I want to stress the point that SBMM helped me play too. I know standard exists, but it's clear it won't be getting the new playlists like open will. (Hope I'm wrong on this in the future).

Zombies is fun, but I feel some changes need to be made for it to be more enjoyable across the board. (Zombies is also getting some changes in the season 1 update).

There's my thoughts on the game as a whole.

I WILL UPDATE MY REVIEW IF THINGS CHANGE!

BF6 > COD7

As someone who was very against buying BO7, I went against my word and purchased the game. It is surprisingly really well done and for the first time in a long time, I am having fun in a Call of Duty title. It is definitely not BO2, but it does have the BO2 aesthetic and I honestly love that. 

The omni-movement is cool with being able to sprint in any direction. I still think the tactical slide is too fast and do not like how fast people are able to zip around the map, but I personally am able to overlook it. The wall bounce isn't too crazy. Nothing bad to really say about it. 

With SBMM being removed, I don't feel like I have to put a sweat band on and gear up for the COD Olympics every time I press "Find Match". I am actually dropping kills and having a great time. Some games I fry, some games I get fried. 

TTK feels good. I feel comfortable taking 1vX fights and winning them. With that being said, gunplay also feels good and feels smooth. 

Again, I was very against purchasing another Call of Duty and had already planned on playing Battlefield 6 to get my fill of a competitive shooter, but I am actually glad I bought this game. Overall I give the multiplayer a 7.5 or 8 out of 10. I just hope the game will stay level and not go crazy with skins, tracers, and operators. Keep bringing COD back to a level ground and stay away from the Fortnite BS. 

Also, classic BO2 guns and weapon skins are in the game. That's pretty sick. Well done on that front.

Have played every single call of duty since COD 2 when I was like 7 years old, and have to say this is so unbelievably disappointing. The multiplayer gameplay in isolation is actually not bad at all, the guns are good to use and they made the killstreaks meaningful again. What I am utterly appalled by is the claim they made about SBMM being off, turning it off in the beta, using it as a selling point to get people to buy the game, and then simply bringing it back. First few games were amazing, I was so relieved and had so much fun, I was holding a 2-2.5 elim/death ratio, and then it happened. Sweat lobby after sweat lobby, I would leave games and continuously be put back in the same sweaty games I just left, I'm starting to see familiar names, SBMM is literally the same as the last 5. Every player is prestige 2+ in my games, I join midway into games where other team is in a party of 4-6 streaking against solo players. The only difference I observe is that in every game there is at least one player on the team who is hard negative, so it seems the kept SBMM for the most part, but introduce one bad player to make you feel less shit about the game. SBMM is a plague on COD and destroys the experience of open matchmaking. Make regular matchmaking ping based matchmaking like it used to be and make ranked skill based, its simple? A disgracefully greedy and corrupt gaming company that is unethical beyond belief, and would make the fortune 500 companies look like mother teresa.

I recommend it if you are a true COD fan, this one is far from being the best cod, but still delivers a fun MP experience, with OG maps and new ones. There are some modes with no skill base matchmaking, but in orden to play those they force you to play a variety of gamemodes (tdm, hardp, dom, etc). But to be real, theres a bit of sbmm on those too (imo), but you can go back and have a crazy games as you did in no sbmm era. Leveling weapons feels rewarding because all weapons are balanced at the moment. Havent tried Zombies yet, pretty sure ive read alot of positive comments. Campaign, havent touched it, and doesnt get myu attetion. Miss the good old campaigns.
To be honest, I bought this for the nostalgia, I played Cod since Call of Duty 3, this might not be the best game of all but only playing it takes me back several years.

Hope they bring the OG feeling of COD someday.

I‚Äôm coming into Black Ops 7 as someone who hasn‚Äôt really played the other Black Ops games (except a trial of BO6), so I‚Äôm not some veteran stuck in the past. (Except from playing a lot of other FPS games)
Even from that fresh perspective, the balance in this game is just terrible.

Enemies constantly spawn behind you, sometimes literally 5 meters away. It doesn‚Äôt feel fair or skill-based, it just feels cheap.

Matchmaking is a disaster. You either stomp or get stomped, with very little in between. It often feels like the game throws you into completely random lobbies instead of anything based on skill.

Hit detection / netcode is irritating. In some replays you can clearly see bullets going straight through enemies without doing any damage. I even had a rocket launcher shot pass through someone without taking any damage. That kind of thing completely kills the fun.

To be fair, performance is good, and Zombies is actually pretty fun. Those parts show that there is a good game hiding in here somewhere.

But my big question is: how can Call of Duty, after so many games, still release something with balancing this bad? It feels like they haven‚Äôt learned anything from previous titles.

Call of duty is LOST...

Campaign: Call of duty can't make a story without the premise being about a missile, or a mind numbing schizophrenia chemical agent... The ONLY GOOD MISSION was that one mission on hijacked. Activision can only make the most generic military story, or the most bat shi crazy story in this modern era of gaming. The only good thing that made this campaign playable was the CO-OP mechanic. 3/10 

ZOMBIES: I actually love Zombies. Ashes of the Damned is the best zombies map we have had in this modern formula of COD Zombies. The Easter Egg is so thoughtfully written out and everything feels cohesive. The map is beautiful with the skybox and lighting. The OG characters bring back so much Charm that was missing in BO6. Zombies seems to be getting a lot of content with Cursed Mode. Survival. and Dead Ops Arcade. Dead Ops Arcade has always been fun and I am glad that they kept up the good work with Dead Ops Arcade 4. 8/10! :)

Multiplayer: Welp, I really don't like multiplayer. Bland guns, bland maps, everything feels the exact same but with a futuristic skin on. I just don't find myself enjoying the multiplayer. Everything feels the exact same from BO6. The movement has gotten arguably worse with the addition of wall hopping. It's another lazy attempt to bring some variety in a franchise that needs it desperately. 4/10

Overall: This Call of Duty is yet another one hit wonder where the only thing that feels handcrafted and not soulless is the zombies. With the additional use of AI art, this game feels lacking of any emotion. I have had tons of fun with the zombies but literally everything else about this game is terrible. If you want to buy this game for the zombies, I would look deeper. This game deserves nothing higher than a 4/10. The only good thing is the zombies...

Additionally, if you like to farm weapon skins, good luck. Really hard to get long shot kills when every map is the size of Stakeout.

All is All, at this point, i would accept my money back with the agreeance to never play another COD game again. And that hurts my heart.

My immediate Refund: Call of Duty BO7

The netcode in Call of Duty BO7 is fundamentally broken. Despite having an optimized internet connection with an Open NAT type and consistently maintaining sub-30ms latency, the gameplay experience was ruined by crippling input desync and lag compensation failures.

Shots consistently failed to register, and the delay between my actions and the server's response made fast-paced play impossible. This is a core technical failure. The game is unplayable, and I immediately requested a refund. Avoid this trash

I'm leaving this review as a fellow cod player i do enjoy this game i love the MP that is out i think they stayed to their word with balance and the maps are great the most fun i had in a long time Since bo3. the story mode was lackluster i think that was the most boring and more trash campaign i've ever played in years. Zombies this year has promise but well see what they provide in the seasons i thinks so far its a good experience i like everything but the campaign. i rate this game a 8/10 i stand by this because i really enjoy this over bo6.

- I mean, gunplay is good, grinding camos in multiplayer again is boring, mw had it best, long range, point blank, hipfire but now it's only headshot, trust me for casual players it's hard to get one gun gold. 

-Although I tried zombies and again, it's kinda boring, I wished that it would be good like in bo6, first map was amazing, can't say the same with first one in bo7, again zombies critical kills it's okay that it's not 2000 kills again but also the survival map is the best option to do it and the map is just boring.

-Co op or endgame is kinda fun, mostly for casual players, I like it and hope to see more of that. BUT and a big BUT I got disconnected several times, game crashed, and lost everything, got one gun gold in 7 tries going from CR0, was pretty pissed that I was level max and killed the last boss and exfiled but when trying to level up again, game crashes, I see on reddit this issue is constantly happening to a lot of players, pls fix this ASAP bc you will lose a lot of players.

-And campaign I can't say anything except it's just ass. Wanted to see more Marshal, Woods but you js killed him off and the campaign is boring. Was happy I made it through. 

-Please fix it, it has potential but at this state, it's ass and I rather play other games, I know it's pre season and stuff but also, you really want to show this game to someone at this state? Rather you take another month to fix it. Not publish it with ass endgame servers and camo grinding that's just boring. Give us something new, feels like bo6 DLC. Please and thank you.

In this Review, all I'm going to do is copy/paste my successful Refund Request with an estimated 10-14h gametime with Black Ops 7. 

"Starting this off, surely looking off my library you can see I'm a CoD Fan. Been playing basically every year for many many years by now, but I think I need to take a step back and maybe leave CoD alone for a while.

Learning of the heavily AI-generated content I'm being sold alongside the entirety of the Campaign (Honestly half the reason I ever buy a CoD, the other half is Multiplayer) had me saying words I've never uttered aloud while holding my head. "What the fuck is this writing? What?" The entire campaign is just, awful, and the Endgame game mode is stuck behind completing it. Cool in WAW more than a decade ago for something genuinely new, not nowadays with it being Black Ops DMZ; especially with such a shit campaign. I do not say that lightly; I know everyone's been dogging on it. It's warranted.

The Zombies? I'm not playing it; it's just BO6 Zombies and I didn't even play that. Of course I won't touch that shit. 

I know I dumped at least like 17 hours into BO7 by now alongside getting two guns to Shattered Gold, but I'm really just, regretting my purchase with it. Maybe if it went on an extreme sale, but it is far under my expectations for a at-the-end-of-the-day multi-trillion dollar company. I'm sure I'll get that itch for this game specifically after playing it here and there, but not an itch worth $70. I didn't think I'd spend $70 on a game in which I would play only 1 of the 3 whole experiences they give when I've played everything every year. I didn't wanna be a Battlefield man, but the fates call my name. 

If I can't get a refund, I kinda understand, but at least you'd know I regret my purchase; oh and I'll likely be vocal and summarize what I said here in a review in it. Thank you Steam Reviewer #8008135."

Call of Duty Black Ops 7....  

The campaign is a absolute dumpster Fire. 

The BO7 campaign is so bad it feels like it was written during a power outage using crayons. The story makes no sense. Every mission feels like a random TikTok edit glued together. Characters talk like they‚Äôre reading scripts they saw for the first time that same morning.

The bosses? Bullet sponges from hell. You could empty 12 magazines into one guy and he‚Äôs still alive giving speeches like he‚Äôs running for president. And the plot‚Ä¶ bro. The plot is so confusing I needed a therapist after Mission 3. It‚Äôs not bad in a funny way. It‚Äôs bad in a ‚Äúdid I just waste hours of my life?‚Äù way.

Multiplayer is straight up unplayable comedy.

Multiplayer feels like the devs had a bet to see who could make the worst experience. The guns are either kill in one accidental hipfire, or take 30 bullets and a blood sacrifice. The spawns are so awful you‚Äôll respawn directly inside somebody‚Äôs crosshair, like the game wants you to suffer. The maps look like someone typed ‚Äúgeneric FPS level‚Äù into an AI and pressed enter.

The time to kill? Horrible. The footsteps? oh boi. The UI? Looks like a mobile game from 2014. Every match feels like you‚Äôre fighting the game more than the players.


Zombies is‚Ä¶ okay.

Not amazing, not special, its zombies. It‚Äôs like a decent microwave meal you don‚Äôt love it, but you‚Äôll eat it. The farm map. Too small but fun. Other maps... Hope we get some DLC maps to save it. The guns are usable. Got the ray gun!

The mode doesn‚Äôt actively try to ruin your life. It‚Äôs the only mode where the game feels like it remembered it‚Äôs supposed to be fun. Not great, not iconic just barely keeping BO7 from being a crime.

What really stings is I was actually hyped. A BO2 sequel? I thought we were finally getting a real comeback. Instead BO7 slid in. Stabbed me in the leg. Then the shoulder. Then grabbed a gun and shot me. (If you get the reference. You a real one.)

Far better than I expected. I enjoyed beta a lot despite the glaring issues. Most of which were fixed. They have a lot more to fix but for the amount of content there is, it's decent to great and the music is awesome. As a Warzone player mostly this scratches the itch. 

Far and away better than Battlefield 6 - your bullets actually hit your target and do damage. No hit registration issues. There's bugs and cheaters like all MP games and you just have to report *everyone* all the time so they can be flagged and removed. AntiCheat is a myth and doesn't work for any game. It's all marketing. Don't let that scare you away though, it's fun.

The downside for new players and casual players is there is no SBMM. Removing it was a huge mistake. This will be reflected a HUGE plummet in player numbers as the majority market stops logging in. Eventually, they will put it back or shut it down. For now, you'll have matches where sweats, cheaters, tiktokers, and of course, streamers will farm you. They're the ones that wanted SBMM removed so they could clip vids easier and make more money.

This franchise is the epitome of how greedy AAA developers have gotten. Ever since MW2019, COD has turned into such slop, because they know that every year people will buy it regardless of how horrible it is. As an example of what they've done recently:

- Consolidated every game onto one launcher that is a 150gb install minimum on steam
- Every campaign is now "Warzone-ified", making it feel soulless and incohesive
- AI slop is riddled everywhere and they do not disclose the use of it
- Cosmetics are ridiculous, and are more akin to something you'd see in Fortnite than in a military shooter
- Games are buggy or unfinished on release due to a year development cycle
- Half of the selling points of the new games is recycled stuff from old games, banking on catching people with nostalgia bait

I've been a COD fan since the original Black Ops, but Black Ops 7 is hands-down the WORST Call of Duty game ever made. They cheaped out HARD by stuffing the game with obvious AI-generated garbage ‚Äì calling cards, prestige icons, posters, you name it. It's all that soulless, blurry Studio Ghibli rip-off slop that screams "we couldn't be bothered to hire real artists." Activision even admits on the Steam page they used "generative AI tools" for assets, and it shows ‚Äì lazy, low-effort crap in a $70 AAA title that rakes in billions. This isn't innovation; it's cutting corners to fund more battle passes.
Multiplayer? Recycled BO6 slop with worse TTK, laggy servers, and aim assist on steroids. Campaign? An unpausable, always-online co-op mess that's basically DMZ/Zombies fever dream ‚Äì giant machetes from the sky, skibidi toilet bosses, zero checkpoints. It's like AI wrote the script too.
And Zombies? What a JOKE. Feels like BO6.5 with frustrating randoms, health-bar zombies jumping from nowhere, pointless vehicles, and Pack-a-Punch that's always there but guns still feel like wet noodles past round 30. No soul, no thrill ‚Äì just a points grind that punishes solo play.
Boycott this AI-fueled dumpster fire. Treyarch and Activision killed the franchise. Refunding and moving to Battlefield.

I have played not all but a lot of the recent Call of Duty games, Ghosts, BO2, BO3, BO4, BO5, WW2, MW, MW2, MW3. I can say without a doubt I didn't like the first mission of the campaign. Then I kept playing and realized that it was 11 copy pastes of the same thing. Why was there zombies in the campaign? I love zombies and I usually love Call of Duty Campaigns but this game feels like if you took all the good parts of a Call of Duty and shoved them into a blender until all the parts are so mixed up that none are definitively recognizable. The campaign is online only, and there's zombies. 
Pros for BO7
- You can level in all three big modes and you unlock stuff for each.
- Looks pretty solid
- Movement is nice with the omni directional stuff.
- Cool to see all the Black Ops Stories come to tie in a little

Cons for BO7
- Awful writing for the campaign, I know it's a shooter game so i should just shoot stuff and be happy, but why did we even do all that? The bad people are bad? Ok...? but what did they do other than tell everyone governments are bad?
- Super repetitive gameplay, all the missions have a boss fight that is basically gimic... shoot... wait... repeat. It didn't do anything new or inventive. 
- You couldn't change the difficulty. Me and my brother played the campaign together which was so fun to be able to do... but it was painfully, annoyingly, mind-numbingly easy. There was ammo and sheilds everywhere, you didn't at any point need to be smart. We literally stopped using guns unless for the bosses because to make it an actual challenge we decided to do knives only. If i can basically non-stop tac sprint around directly from one enemy to the next using only a knife, something is wrong. As someone who loved grinding out the WW2 Veteran difficulty and dying over and over and having to use strategy and think of how to use and not use my ammo, it was super frustrating that I didn't need to do that here, but more so that it wasn't even an option. Also when you kill someone they don't drop their gun which is sooooooooo dumb.

In conclusion I was so excited to be a Black Ops operator again and do shady stuff that's morally questionable to "make the world a better place" but it just wasn't there. It was flat characters shooting at npc's that give a clear reason why most where traded out for robots by the time you get to BO3. I love Call of Duty and that's why I felt sick knowing how excited I was for this and then seeing it in action.

The multiplayer was pretty cool and I'm excited for zombies but as someone who doesn't just love Call of Duty for the guns and explosions this game is garbage. I prolly won't get the next one when it comes out.

This game is genuinely disappointing. The biggest problem is the terrible spawn system‚Äîespecially in TDM. If a team pushes your spawn and wipes you, they shouldn‚Äôt respawn right behind you only for you to die again. It completely breaks the flow of the match.

Movement itself is fine, but the speed and excessive head-bobbing make gunfights feel chaotic. Good luck winning engagements unless you‚Äôre using an SMG; once again, they‚Äôre laser-accurate bullet hoses with absurd stopping power.

Zombies is passable, basically on the same level as Black Ops 6. The campaign, however, feels like an afterthought. It barely seems worth having, unless you enjoy shooting oversized enemies that vomit on you and react like someone playing peekaboo with a toddler.

Overall, save your money. The game just isn‚Äôt worth it.

Before evaluating the game, I want to make one point: focus on what's right in front of you.I'm playing on Game Pass.Personally, I find this game enjoyable. The SBMM feels less punishing, and the current content volume, weapon quality, and map quality all feel solid overall. Compared to BO6, BO7 is a significant improvement, and it feels like the developers have changed. But looking around, it's constantly being compared to BF6, and the internet is flooded with negative reviews and critical comments. Reading this is surprising. Times change, and while the past might have been better, I don't think it's good to cling too tightly to it. That's precisely why I believe we should evaluate a game based on the game itself, without being swayed by external factors. I love both BF and COD, which is exactly why I feel this way even more.

Black Ops 7 is the second COD I've played on PC (first being BO3), and I enjoy the gameplay of multiplayer and zombies. As of this review, I have yet to touch the campaign, but I would say a lot of people wait for a rainy day before even touching a COD campaign anyways.  I'm not a fan of the excessive use of AI, which is typically easily to point-out, but I do like seeing that COD is paying more attention to the multiplayer and zombies fanbases, instead of catering mainly to the warzone players.  I'd give it a 7.5/10 before playing any kind of future DLC drops.  If they remaster a lot more of the BO2 maps down the line, that alone would ease it up to an 8/10.

I bought BF 6 first, but thought it was kind of boring and full of bots.
Refunded it and decided to try BO7, even though almost everyone had a negative attitude toward it. Reviews, Youtubers, and such.

Fortunately, It turned out to be a great game. It runs well, plays great, and I genuinely enjoyed the campaign. Despite all the hate, the story kept me engaged. It‚Äôs a game, so it gets silly sometimes, and that‚Äôs perfectly fine. The boss fights were a bold move and surprisingly well executed. They reminded me of classic single player shooters from the 2010s.
Multiplayer is the main reason people buy Call of Duty, and this one delivers. Matchmaking is fast, lobbies are active, and the maps are a big improvement over BO6. Zombies also brings back that nostalgic fun. I had a great time with it.

So, If you're like me and was struggling to enjoy a call of duty game in the past years, then I recommend you give this one a real shot. It's one of the good ones.

After playing another extraction shooter that just came out and then coming to this game, BO7 feels stale and bland in comparison.

I got it for the multiplayer lobby experience, and it fell severely short. It doesn't feel epic and modern, but rather a time machine back to 2010. The graphics are extremely plain, the gun play feels simple, and it feels extremely twitchy.

I see what they were trying to do when it came to what "fun" in a game means: move faster, move more. This is what Doom Eternal did, and it worked. But BO7 missed the mark by not providing a punchy, fun, and suspenseful feeling to go along with the quick movement. Everything feels ... limp. I'm not sure how else to put it.

Plus the sound design of this game is leagues behind the recent extraction shooter that just came out.

Everything about this game just feels very one-dimensional.

Even the voice acting lacks emotion and feeling. I'm unsure if they used AI to do the narration, but if they didn't, they need to fire their VA's and replace them lol. If they used AI, they need to do a better job at prompting. I'm not against the use of AI to design a game, but if the game isn't a fun experience, then it doesn't matter if they use AI or not.

I'm not even going to bother with the campaign. I've heard and read enough about that experience to know it's going to be a joke on a stick.

I will be getting a refund. Go play the other game.

The biggest issue with this game is the launcher and the single-player experience.
In the very first mission I was kicked for inactivity while moving in prone, trying to stay undetected. The always online requirement makes things even worse, and the default setting that forces squad fill completely ruins the feel of a true solo campaign. Overall, it‚Äôs a thoroughly disappointing single player experience.

The graphics are a mixed bag. Cut scenes look fantastic, but in actual game play, objects and item outlines visibly pop in and out while standing still. It breaks immersion and feels unpolished.

Multiplayer, on the other hand, is genuinely great for COD fans and new players. They finally got that part right. Reused maps aren‚Äôt a problem, but some of the new ones feel too open on the left and right lanes, which leads to constant cross-fire from multiple angles. Still, aside from a few map issues, multiplayer is solid.

The game is really only worth it for multiplayer. With so many reused assets and a weak single-player mode, it‚Äôs hard to justify the $70 price tag. You‚Äôre better off waiting for a sale.

This is my review about Call of Duty - Black Ops 7 

Call of Duty is listed in my review as (Got for free) this is not true, this is only cause CALL OF DUTY has combined all their titles in one home game, this *HOME* is free for everyone.

I bought the Vault Edition on Playstation 5, 
because this is Steam, I will keep my review only about the aspects regarding the game itself. 



Multiplayer - MP
Zombies - ZW

MP = Maps - Alot of 'comebacks' of old maps from previous C.O.D titles, for 'veterans' is it a nice nostalgic map experience, it are small but providing areas with a fresh '2025' texture look. 

ZW = Maps - For now only one is live, more are coming if I heard it right. So far is the 'Ashes of the Damned' a large wide open map with alot of Easter Eggs, secrets and possibilities. They added some extra's but further then that, the rest is like most people are known with.

Gameplay - Same as every shooter, controls. (custom controls are possible - Playstation, Xbox, Keyboard). Only diffrence is the (re)added wall jump movements and 'wall double jumping'.

Skill Matching - MP - I Played every game mode, on average I am very skilled, but most random team and enemies are pretty balanced in playing. (1 out of 10 is like a 'please no').

Connection - so far hadn't got problems, server is stable I think

Campaign= I did not fully completed campaign, can't say too much about it yet, what I do know is that if you expect campaign mode to be played offline or like you expect it to be (from previous titles), I wont recommend buying the game for Campaign, if that is mainly your purpose. Besides that or If you don't care, the graphics, the cutscenes and music, the weapons and character/skill progress are very good.


*Score = All aspects per category = average = score*
 Conclusion: 

+ M.P 8/10
+ Z.W 7/10
- Campaign 5/10

! 
About the price on every platform is (expensive) for what they offer *RIGHT NOW* altough alot of things and content expect to be added in the near future, so probaly around then it would fit the price.

Call of Duty - Black Ops 7 

My average score total: 6.5 of 10


-Marvin Deddens

What‚Äôs Bad About the New CoD

Overpowered Killstreak ("Gravemaker")

There‚Äôs a wall-hack sniper rifle (‚ÄúThe Gravemaker‚Äù) that lets you see through walls, and a lot of players are calling it broken. 
GamesRadar+

High-level players (including pros) are already dominating with it. 
GamesRadar+

No Pause in Campaign

Several players are furious that you can‚Äôt pause the campaign mode. > ‚Äúyou‚Äôre telling me i can‚Äôt even pause my game?‚Äù 
Reddit
+1

That‚Äôs a pretty big deal for people who like to play solo or in short bursts.

Always-Online Requirements

It seems like the campaign and other modes require a constant online connection, which annoys players who want a more traditional offline experience. 
Reddit
+1

This ties in with the pause issue: because it's always online, they may not have built in a pause feature.

Scope Creep / Series Fatigue

Some long-time CoD fans feel like the franchise is becoming repetitive: same movement mechanics, similar UI, and too many ‚Äúpay-for‚Äù cosmetics. > ‚Äúevery game now feeling the same again and again.‚Äù 
Reddit

There‚Äôs frustration with the business model ‚Äî yearly releases, microtransactions, and battle passes.

Narrative Might Be Overly Complex / Fragmented

While some praise the campaign for being ‚Äúhallucinogenic‚Äù and ambitious, others point out that the story leans heavily on past games, which could alienate newcomers. 
Diario AS
+1

The Endgame mode (co-op, open-world-ish) is cool to some, but others say it overlaps too much with the main story. 
Diario AS

AI Use in Development

There‚Äôs a report that Activision used AI to generate some in-game assets, which has raised eyebrows about quality and effort. 
Business Insider

Some players worry that this could mean ‚Äúcheap‚Äù content or less polish in important areas.

Awesome, like most of the COD franchise games, although if playing on pc and using a ps5 controller, the controls glitches pretty bad and quite often. It became be extremely frustrating for a while. Not sure what the issue is regarding that but other than that "kinda big issue" the game is great.

‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ Black Ops 7 Campaign Review: A Confusing Fever Dream With Guns

Playing the Black Ops 7 campaign feels like eating a bowl of cereal only to realize halfway through that it‚Äôs actually drywall crumbs and no one knows who poured it. The game insists it has a deep, emotional, world-shattering narrative, but honestly? I‚Äôve seen clearer storytelling in IKEA instruction manuals ‚Äî at least those come with little pictures so you know what's happening.

The plot jumps around so much that by Mission 3 I thought my console was skipping. One minute you're infiltrating a secret base, the next you're in a flashback, inside a dream, inside someone else's flashback, narrated by a guy who feels like he‚Äôs making it up as he goes. By Mission 6 I was expecting the game to suddenly ask me about my car‚Äôs extended warranty.

The characters? Imagine trying to bond with cardboard cutouts, except the cutouts occasionally yell military clich√©s like ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt leave people behind!‚Äù before immediately leaving someone behind. The villain shows up roughly twice, says something sinister, and then apparently goes on vacation for the rest of the campaign.

Gameplay-wise, the missions swing between ‚Äúwalk forward and shoot things‚Äù and ‚Äúwalk forward slightly slower and shoot things while the NPC next to you delivers emotional monologues that sound AI-generated.‚Äù The game pretends to offer choices, but the only real decision you get is whether to roll your eyes now or later.

And the ending‚Ä¶ oh boy. It feels like the writers had a meeting, collectively forgot what the story was about, shrugged, and slapped on a twist so confusing it may actually violate several storytelling laws.

In short: If you want a campaign that makes you question reality, coherence, and your own life choices, Black Ops 7 has you covered. If you want a good campaign? Try literally anything else ‚Äî maybe even those IKEA instructions.

I've only played Warzone until now, never owned any multiplayer game. as far as warzone is concerned it is good. Graphics is phenomenal, one of the top battle Royale out there. Team play is generally better than solo.

I tried going into this with low expectations because of videos I saw saying it was gonna be trash, but unironically this game is so fucking fun. Multiplayer is so far 7/10, i wish it had gun game but i guess it makes sense since non of us have all the weapons unlocked and it might be too early for it. The non-sbmm matchmaking is truly living up to what the COD community wanted, the standard moshpit is kind of hidden enough that I feel like nobody is going to actually use it and will instead use the open moshpit. The non-disbanding lobbies are another positive, however it does suck that nobody is on the mic.

Now zombies, I did not expect to have this much fucking fun on zombies, i'm a multiplayer player only usually but i tried the survival zombies mode and god damn was it fun, made it until round 25 but my team decided they wanted to exif or whatever even though I was down to go another 20 rounds. I would say zombies is 8/10, i just don't really like the armour system because it just becomes a game of remembering to put my armour on. 

If you are reading this just be aware that most reviews here right now are bf6 players mass-negative reviewing this game, i personally don't care that much, any competition is good competition, but just be aware of this if you are using reviews to dictate if you want to get this or not. I do think BO7 actually has a chance at becoming one of the best COD's, and i'm saying this as someone who's favourite COD game is BO3 and BO2 (the nostalgia bait worked, highjacked plays really well, and the wall jumping this is close enough to bo3's wallride that it makes me happy). 

Now about the small bits of negatives i have for this game: 1.) some of the menu text is messed up as in sometimes it overlaps. 2.) Who even came of with the COD launcher thing, it's clunky and annoying. 3.) The game takes far too long to load up, as in GTA5 levels of loading time. 4.) for launch day I was expecting a bit more challenges to level up fast, im surprised to only be doing 5.) the game chat is a bit too hidden, I would prefer if all we had to do type was click y instead of going on a whole other menu. 6.) Now this is just nitpicking but why did it take so long for the fucking tutorials to load up.

If you're on the fence about this game, let me make it easy for you - DO NOT BUY THIS GARBAGE

Even if you have 70$ Burning a hole in your pocket it is not worth it. I have never in my life played a game that sucks this bad. Even the last 5 games sucked but had enjoyable gun-play mechanics - not this game. The guns are terrible, the maps are terrible, the movement is somehow more sluggish even with wall-running, and everyone you fight is guaranteed to be using a cronus. 

If you're wanting to play the campaign - don't bother, it's slop

If you're wanting to play Zombies - don't bother, it's slop. And to add to that, why are there vehicles in Zombies? This is such a terrible idea and it feels awful to play. 

If you're wanting to play Multiplayer - DO NOT BOTHER- IT IS SLOP - Even BO4 and 6 felt better to play than this. ALSO there is somehow major lag sutters from packetloss that freeze your game at least 3 times a match. I have 1BG/s internet speeds and felt like I was playing with 10Mb/s speeds on BO2. This is pathetic and a waste of time and money. 

My score? 1/10, as a longtime COD fan since COD 3, this is a complete slap in the face. I refunded after 4 awful MP matches which all played on the same 2 maps (not a big map pool) and 1 round of zombies that was extremely depressing to play considering how good Bo1, Bo2, Bo3, and even Bo4 zombies is. Heck, I would even put IW and AW zombies over this abomination of a so-called zombies mode. 

My message to Activition is very clear - F@@@ You for destroying our favorite franchise and making a mockery of what all the devs in the past built up. Anyone who took part in making this game has absolutely zero passion or idea of what Call of Duty should be. It's a disgrace.

When you prioritize shareholders over players, you end up with what has happened the last 5+ years. After BO2, the series regressed with some decent games here and there. Ultimately, the series will never be as fun as it once was. I play the original MW2 (2009) still and it absolutely dog walks all of their recent games in numerous ways. The FPS genre has become too big and AAA developers try to make a game for everyone which 95% of the time does not work. Instead of the focus being fun, we have shifted the focus to making money, which I understand, this is a business. But in the modern era of entertainment, we try to make art that isn't enjoyable but brings in the most social media clicks and money instead of bringing happiness. I have finally given up on Call of Duty ever being as great as it was. Hoping the developers across the board can shift into something else and find success in another IP, because Call of Duty's dominance over the market is over.

I honestly don‚Äôt get the hate this game is getting. Is it just because it has the CoD label on it? This is my first CoD and I‚Äôm having a blast. Multiplayer and zombies both hit the spot, and the constant BF6 trash talk feels more like fanboy noise than anything real. Funny thing is, I‚Äôve never heard CoD players go after Battlefield the same way.

I own both games and, objectively, CoD is the one I keep coming back to. It‚Äôs polished, runs smoothly, and I haven‚Äôt hit a single bug or cheater so far. The gameplay is quick and satisfying, and every gun I‚Äôve tried is actually fun instead of a painful grind. BF6 makes early weapons feel like a punishment and unlocking anything takes forever. Here, progression is fast and enjoyable. New guns, attachments, toys to play with, all without dumping 500 hours into the grind.

The maps are great and the walljump surprised me in the best way. I thought I‚Äôd hate it, but it feels fantastic. Overall, the game is just pure joy to play.

Instead of listening to the usual CoD hate train, just try it yourself. You might end up loving it as much as I do.

‚≠ê 1/5 ‚Äì Call of Duty Has Completely Lost Its Identity

Call of Duty used to be a franchise built on innovation, iconic gameplay and unforgettable moments. Today, it feels like a factory product‚Äîrushed, uninspired, and stuck in a loop of repeating the same mistakes year after year.

Multiplayer:
The multiplayer is a mess. The time-to-kill is absurdly low, movement feels stiff yet chaotic at the same time, and the map design ranges from painfully linear corridors to empty, oversized spaces with no real flow. Skill-Based Matchmaking turns every match into a sweaty tournament instead of something fun.

Warzone:
Warzone is drowning in bugs, lag spikes, broken hit detection and questionable balance decisions. Looting feels inconsistent, gunfights feel random, and cheaters still ruin entire matches despite years of promises.

Content & Monetization:
Instead of meaningful content, we get overpriced skins, crossover bundles that don‚Äôt fit the game at all, and recycled ideas disguised as ‚Äúnew seasons.‚Äù Features get removed, reintroduced, changed again, or simply forgotten. Nothing feels stable or coherent.

Technical Issues:
Crashes, server instability, poor optimization‚Äîthese problems appear every single year. For a AAA franchise, it‚Äôs unacceptable.

And Black Ops 7? Just as bad.

Black Ops 7 was hyped as a ‚Äúreturn to form,‚Äù but it delivers the same recycled gameplay, shallow design, and technical problems as the rest. It adds nothing new, fixes next to nothing, and feels like a copy-paste of previous titles with a fresh coat of paint.
It‚Äôs disappointing, predictable, and absolutely not worth the price tag.

Final Verdict:

Call of Duty is no longer a passionate shooter experience‚Äîit‚Äôs a yearly product pumped out with minimal effort. If you‚Äôre looking for fun, creativity or quality, Black Ops 7 and the entire current CoD lineup will only leave you frustrated.

Many of these games are plagued with issues stemming from their over-reliance upon SBMM to retain playercount and the constant release of unbalanced bundles. The campaign is consistently and unapologetically propaganda with poor narrative structuring and no sense of stakes every year for the last six years, and recently they've just tried to make every campaign a lazily slapped together warzone map with the same characters as games from 2010. The bundles I mentioned before get more and more stupid looking every month or so over the course of the year incrementally to the point where at the end, I expect a literal downs syndrome operator being pushed out (would still be more bearable than chucky). The ranked play has a hidden axis of SBMM so you have fake platinums running around not playing the objective if you're unfortunate enough to have not done well on the previous match. The maps often have poor spawn mechanics, sometimes spawning you right next to groups of enemies. We thought this was going to be fixed after the beta every year, but it never was. The zombies feels like an empty husk of all those nachts we left behind, with warzone mechanics and repetitive, easy gameplay. All of this, as bad as it somehow is, doesn't outweigh the positives of this game however. I genuinely love the feeling of playing a hardpoint match on skyline in ranked play when the teams are balanced and the spawns function properly. Gunfight is endearing as hell, as you and a buddy can menace the other team more personally when you win and then intensify that behavior more when you lose immediately after. There's hardly a source of dopamine in the world that outweighs queuing with your friends in resurgence warzone and then barely rubbing out a victory when you're heavily outnumbered. The camos on the guns being able to be combined with the blueprints is a genius system and results in some stunning outcomes. The process of leveling is neither too slow or too fast, and gives me the sensation of always having a direct goal put in front of me, whether it's a camo or an unlockable item. There are a LOT of things to do in this game. Once a zombies match hits level 30, it suddenly becomes one of the most enjoyable things about this purchase, with hectic squeezes requiring precise coordination with your team, and bosses actually fulfilling their design philosophy. I both hated and loved this game, and it was a rollercoaster for the entire year. Black Ops 7 releases in 30 minutes, and you can bet your ass I preordered it and maxed out the beta. Give these games a chance, and you might be pleasantly surprised.

I have been a huge fan of the COD games from the very first one. The game itself can be a lot of fun, has good graphics, and the multiplayer part playing with friends can be a blast. With that said, these games seem to have more issues as each new one is released. Activision and their parent company Microsoft have made it very apparent that they do not value their decade or more loyal fans. It is becoming more and more about just what skins and other stuff they can sell in the game or charge $30 for one season of the Blackcell pass for example. Like zombies? Lot of fun in this game....when you can use fun things like the gum especially. But once you hit a high enough level you stop earning any of the good ones by playing and they want you to buy them in the store. The days of paying for a game you enjoy and then unlock everything from gameplay and skill while the developers focus first and foremost on functionality and treating their loyal customers like they aren't something to just blatantly take advantage of. As they focus on these things as well as the chat ban vs. caring about cheating issue (will explain next) the quality of the game, functionality, cheating, mentality of the true problem people, lag, crashes, etc. are all affected by this.

Last thing, the chat ban using AI part they began using in BO6. I have heard people say the most obscene things you can say and they are reported and nothing happens. Some even brag that they have paid somehow to not get banned. Yet if you say certain select words in a MA rated game about shooting people you are banned for a couple of weeks on average with no way to appeal it. Now if someone is clearly hacking and you report them, nothing is done 99% of the time. 

The point is this and many other COD games are overall a lot of fun. But this focus on being most concerned about single words being said in a non-threatening purely opinion expressing way one time and you can be banned 15 seconds later as well as focus on profit to a far too extreme degree given the cost to the players in quality of the game experience is ruining these games. I never write reviews but I am far from the only person who feels this way. 

If they simply used people to determine bans and had an actual appeal process available a certain amount of times to determine which people truly are a problem and listened to the input of their long-time fans and accepted a small profit reduction to fix these things they probably would make more once some of the people they have lost for these reasons came back and played the new COD games again when released. Maybe they will realize a lot more people than they think aren't stupid and are aware of this scheme to keep people playing as long as possible to sell things and once you no longer have incentive of a level to go any higher you all of a sudden have to purchase things you easily would earn before that.

PLayed the BO7 campaign, finished all missions and unlocked endgame. Gotta say it's the most fun I've ever played since MW2019. Every Mission is atmospheric and frenetic af. Ain't no way someone getting bored here. I tip my hat to activision, cuz OMG! visual fidelity wise crisp and so stunning. The details in cutscenes are INSANE! I flipping love it!!! The game also offers ray traced reflections (OFC OPTIONAL). If your PC is beefy enough, go for it. I have a RTX 5080, played on 4k with RT on high (is the max) and DLSS - not a single performance issue.  Overall the campaign is sick and I would recommend to play at least once the campaign. If you don't like CoD, listen that's totally fine, just get a PC gamepass and enjoy the story once. 

Multiplayer is amazing and Activision made a mistake here, which is missleading. So there are 2 playlists for MP. The Open playlist as we know with "no sbmm" and there is a second playlist called Standard, which has the known SBMM since MW2019. I don't know why, but the "Standard" isn't the Standard. That's so confusing I know. While Open Playlist offers full range of game modes, the standard one has only single game mode called moshpit. 

Because of this people think SBMM is back as default, but that isn't true. Open is still the default, at least for now and I don't think this will change in future. Activision should rework the terminology of the playlist to avoid further confusion.  As for the gameplay, come on XD It's CoD! creme de la creme frenetic fun gunplay. Either you like it or not - it is how it is. And if yall think open playlist is less sweaty PHAHAHAHAHA keep belivin that I guess x'D Me personally, I love it! In this action packed environment I just feel alive and that's why I love this franchise. 

Didn't test zombies yet, but my plans are at least playing 3k hours till MW4 comes out - PEACE!

Warzone is a good game but it mainly has 2 issues.

First off, the game is extremely demanding if you come from a game like Rainbow 6 Siege, Valorant or Fortnite (CS2 players are too invested to dare to switch games) if you play WZ on lowest settings it still looks pretty good though, I personally would add a color filter to it through the NVIDIA App or AMD Software.

Warzone is well-known to be riddled with cheaters, but now it seems to be way better than it used to. I have only rarely encountered any cheaters. 

In WZ there are casual modes, which at the core are the same as the normal one, but have bots. If you play the casuals and drop 30 bombs, you will still not hold up by yourself in the normal modes, but if you grind enough and get your game-sense right you can surely integrate to the normal modes.

Overall:

Graphics ~
Gameplay +
Cheaters +~

Do I like Call of Duty? Yes. Do I think it‚Äôs underdeveloped and not worth $70? Also yes. I‚Äôve been playing since BO2, and while I do enjoy the new movement mechanics brought in with BO6, I feel that the game as a whole is horrible to play when dealing with hyper competitive twelve year olds. I wish there were modes that focused on not using SBM, and I really wish there was an offline mode to some of the game modes. The game is graphically intense, and yet somehow runs better than Final Fantasy 15 did at launch. I would recommend this game only if you like an okay zombies, a mid campaign, and an alright multiplayer experience. Otherwise, save your money.

This game is Dead, I have 2 TB of storage on my computer and this game is so big it takes up over 1/3 of all my storage. It has gotten to the point that i'm going to have to delete Cod just so i can enjoy all the games i want to play.

    If you want a solid FPS experience go play Battle Field 6, if you want an actually playable and enjoyable zombies experience go buy BO1, BO2, or BO3, (which is 1/10th the disc space and 1000x higher quality of gameplay and map design).

    It is sad to see that call of duty has gone down the rabbit hole of greed. After the removal of David Vauhndihar and Jason Blundell it has been clear through the reuse of assets and game mechanics that Treyarch and all other COD titles no longer care in innovate and grow the game in a positive way. 

    If you look at BO1-BO4 they pushed these games to their limits, With story line, Gameplay, and Map design. You will never see passion like those games again from this title unless they completely gut all their major devisions and create a quality game. 

    My simple solution, show ads during loading screens. Make the shop a 3 click access, DO NOT FORCE THE PLAYER INTO THE SHOP ON GAME START UP. FUCK COMSETICS. and bring back PAID DLCs. Take pride in your work and try and make a game that players will enjoy. Not for the middle schoolers. but for adults. the people who grew up on this game. 

    Take Vanoss Gamings COD video. He doesnt play anymore because its too competitive. Its not fun. COD is not a fucking fun game anymore, Its a waste of hard drive space and a waste of money. I will not be purchasing a COD game until it meets my expectations which im entirely confident that it never will. I highly suggest if you are reading this to up vote it and help this studio realize what their priorities need to be. Fuck you Treyarch. You used to give me shivers now all you give me is disgust and resentment.

BO6 is an enjoyable game when it hits its stride. I was, at first, able to put aside the aggressive commercialisation of the game due to its excellent game feel. But then...

With the imminent release of BO7, a 70GB update has been released. It downloads BO7 content, even if you have not bought it. The launcher has been updated; a one-time, unskippable video plays out after the download, and it asks you to do the first time setup again. BO6 is now a separate executable, but still must be launched via the COD app. BO6 has been significantly cut down, with all playlists except 3 moshpits removed.

To reiterate, all players are required to get a 70GB download for BO7, even if you do not want it, and the matchmaking of BO6 has been gutted. Truthfully, I was beginning to get tired of BO6's maps by this stage anyway - they are too clearly drawn to fit a three-lane template - but with the heavy-handed push to attempt to force users to move to BO7, Activision are poised to turn many players sour. I recommend avoiding it.

Honestly, I don‚Äôt like a few things about this game. For one, it makes no sense that when you jump out of the plane with a parachute, you don‚Äôt actually have your own weapons with you. Instead, you have to run around opening crates to find guns and armor, which just feels completely unrealistic. On top of that, I think it‚Äôs unfair that more experienced players‚Äîat least it seems this way‚Äîget better default gear or advantages. As a new player, you‚Äôre at a disadvantage from the start, which just doesn‚Äôt feel fair. A game should be balanced so that everyone has an equal footing, whether they‚Äôre new or veterans.

Also, the whole idea of this gas closing in on the map at a ridiculous speed is just stupid. Instead of focusing on combat, you end up running from this gas cloud that moves almost as fast as you do. It‚Äôs totally ridiculous, and they should make it more realistic. And another thing, when you jump out of the plane, a parachute is a one-time thing. You shouldn‚Äôt be able to use it every single time you jump off a building. You should have to use stairs or ropes or something realistic. And the soldier movements are just nonsense‚Äîlike a soldier jumping around in a way that would never happen.

In short, they need to fix the game to be more realistic: you jump out of the plane with your weapons, everyone should have equal conditions, and get rid of the gas concept if you just want to rush the match. If people want fast matches, have a separate mode for that. But if it‚Äôs a war game, let it be a real war game.

i got back into this because of 2019 MW and it was awesome...until the hacking...well MW2, MW3, Coldwar, Black ops 6 EVERYTHING since 2019 has been ruled by hackers, it doesn't matter if you play warzone or black ops, hell i even found a hacker in zombies. The game fell apart mid MW and when MW2 hit the game mechanics and bugs were a massive issue, took almost until MW3 to fix, i didn't get it, there were positive reviews but still had issues and hackers, We've been promised since 2019 that hackers will be dealt with and every new game theres promises of better anti cheats that activistion created instead of getting some actual good anti cheats and hackers fly through this supposid anti cheat because it's just gotten worse. Now a lot of hackers "closet hack" so try not to show they're hacking with at least having walls cause that's all you need. I keep taking brakes months at a time and just got back into it for the halloween event and no joke from game 1 there were problems and about 2 weeks or less of play i've heard from others that a lot of these problems happened months prior but no fixes which means when i was done for awhile more BS just happened. Theres now an exploit in hardcore S&D that allows your AMP to hear footsteps usable the entire game instead of just being a field upgrade you can occasionally use depending on how well you do. The games a joke and i still hear people are gonna buy BO7 which releases in a week and thats the problem, all the skins and other in app purchases is what runs this and makes the company not give a f**k about their product, it's a game that feels like the creators don't play. Sad thing is i kept this short, i have spent 1000+ hours i practically lived in this game Regardless warzone or multiplayer i rocked at this game, love it more than others but all these problems just make it not fun then you add the hackers and you get more pissed off that this isn't being dealt with that it's like...why do i even play and keep dropping the game for months at a time just to come back and find new problems and some massive issues still not fixed. Oh another new issue is you can start in the game but the game keeps random people from actually starting for 5 seconds or more so when you do by the time you move the enemies are coming around the corner of your spawn or depending on the map killed you the second you could move. again i mainly play HC S&D so not respawning until next round really impacts you. If you enjoy zombies though, it's nice for that, i only ran into a hacker 3 times out of the time i've played which was most of my game time until i hopped into multiplayer. I have been considering buying a copy for my brother JUST for zombies  cause he doesn't like COD in general but zombies he had fun with previous titles and i think zombies was the biggest improvement and had some good devs working on it. Just irritated about the Anti Cheat portion of the company.

With nearly 1,000 hours, I‚Äôve seen the game at its best and its worst. There were definitely high points, for example the 2022 Halloween event was fantastic, and the release of Modern Warfare III brought back a lot of fun and excitement. Back then, I was playing daily and genuinely enjoying the game.

Unfortunately, everything changed with the release of Black Ops 6. Movement became unnecessarily complicated, making gameplay feel less fluid and enjoyable. Skins and cosmetic items have started to feel more like jokes than rewards, and the overall quality  that used to define the series seems to be missing. Cheaters are still a problem, and while there is an anti-cheat system in place, it hardly feels effective.
What was once a game I loved has now become frustrating and disappointing. I no longer find it worth launching, let alone playing. It‚Äôs sad to see a game I loved so much change for the worse.

Call of Duty¬Æ has really lost its charm compared to older entries like Black Ops 2. The game feels overcomplicated and overly focused on flashy, high-tech gadgets rather than solid gunplay and map design. Everything moves so fast now that strategy and tactical play often take a backseat to chaotic sprinting and futuristic abilities. The maps feel cluttered, the killstreaks and tech can be overwhelming, and it‚Äôs hard to feel the same satisfaction from a clean gunfight as you did in the older titles. For longtime fans, it‚Äôs frustrating to see the series trade the simplicity and balance that made it fun for a spectacle-heavy, hyper-technical shooter that often feels more stressful than enjoyable.

Review: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare II

Honestly, this was the worst 110 minutes I‚Äôve ever spent on a game. Modern Warfare II feels like a recycled mess that the developers clearly only care about milking for cash. The same dumb glitches that have been around for over a year are still there ‚Äî broken hit detection, random crashes, and bugs that make you wonder if they even test their updates.

Instead of fixing the problems or improving gameplay, they just keep pumping out overpriced skins and ‚Äúnew‚Äù bundles like that‚Äôs what anyone actually asked for. It‚Äôs all about the microtransactions now, not the players.

I gave it another shot hoping it might‚Äôve improved since launch ‚Äî big mistake. Nothing has changed except my patience. This game isn‚Äôt worth your time or money.

How to play warzone in 2026

1. Open Steam
2. Search for Call of Duty: Warzone and download it (u gonna download call of duty hq not warzone)
3. Download 150GB within 6 days
4. Open the game
5. You will encounter a problem: the game is not compatible with your device
6. Look for a solution from Indian YouTubers
7. You will enter the game and wait for several hours, not minutes
8. You will download 25GB of game add-ons
9. You will be asked to log back into the game after completion
10. The antiheat will malfunction, causing a blue screen
11. You will resolve the issue and try again
12. You will log in and begin collecting shaders, which will take at least two hours
13. You will enter the game and then encounter a server and connection problem
14. You will resolve the issue and log back in, repeating the previous process
15. You will enter the game and start playing, then experience a sudden crash due to insufficient Shader Collection
16. You will repeat the previous steps and log back in to play.
17. You will play for two minutes and then die because of cheaters, and you'll get shadowbans for no reason instead.
18. You'll delete the game and curse the entire team and the whole Call of Duty series for giving you the worst version.
19. You'll start complaining about the game in this review
